definitions.definition: A branch of linguistics studying the meaning of words.
examples: Semantics is a foundation of lexicography .

definitions.definition: The study of the relationship between words and their meanings.
The meaning or set of meanings of a linguistic element, such as a word , morpheme or utterance .
examples: In very ancient or poorly documented languages, the precise semantics of words tend to be uncertain.

subdefinitions.definition: The meanings of individual words, as opposed to the overall meaning of a passage.
examples: The semantics of the terms used are debatable.

definitions.definition: The meaning of computer language constructs, in contrast to their form or syntax .

examples: Who cares? This is all just semantics !
definitions.label_groups: loosely , colloquial , of a detail or distinction

main_definition: ( linguistics ) A branch of linguistics studying the meaning of words.
secondary_definitions: The study of the relationship between words and their meanings.
The meaning or set of meanings of a linguistic element, such as a word , morpheme or utterance .
( computer science ) The meaning of computer language constructs, in contrast to their form or syntax .
( loosely , colloquial , of a detail or distinction ) Pettiness or triviality .
